body: Remove recursive calling code --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/1645)

comment_data.body: This line contains trailing whitespace. Please remove it.

comment_regular_data.body:
Hi @zgfzgf, this looks decent. Can you fix the formatting according to restyled (and astyle in Travis CI)? The "asan" test failure isn't related to your change, so you can ignore it (I need to figure out why this keeps happening, but you can ignore it for now).

We also have a check to limit the number of recursive calls in toxcore, which will probably fail now because you've eliminated one instance of recursion (ideally we have no recursion at all anywhere). Look at other/analysis/check_recursion for the list of recursive functions.

I do not know what this means, what is the specific format?
? Validator: TITLE
? (Semantic release conventions must be followed. OR Dependabot PRs are exempt from semantic release conventions.)
Input : Restyle perf: Remove recursive calling code
Settings : {"or":[{"must_include":{"regex":"^(feat|docs|chore|cleanup|fix|refactor|test|style|perf)(\\(\\w+\\))?:\\ .+$","message":"Semantic release conventions must be followed."}},{"must_include":{"regex":"^Bump [^ ]* from [^ ]* to [^ ]*$","message":"Dependabot PRs are exempt from semantic release conventions."}}]}
Travis CI - Pull Request  Failing after 1m — Build Failed is + Blank line

[![CLA assistant check](https://cla-assistant.io/pull/badge/signed)](https://cla-assistant.io/TokTok/c-toxcore?pullRequest=1645)
All committers have signed the CLA.

"add_to_list -> add_to_list" in  other/analysis/check_recursion 
@iphydf I delete it

@zgfzgf it's failing the test, which means this implementation does not behave the same way as the old one. Is that intentional?
